oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: The Implications of Integration for Trade Unions, Business and Industry
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Workshop report, written by W. R. Volckhausen, discussing a labor workshop on integration in 1957. The workshop examined the effect of integration on the labor movement in the South, arguing that it would lose the moral high ground if it did not integrate. Discrimination in employment affected all workers and allying with Black workers would only strengthen the unions.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Volckhausen, W.R.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Labor unions--Organizing--United States; Highlander Folk School (Monteagle, Tenn.); Discrimination in employment; Labor movement; Labor unions; Race relations; Labor leaders; Communities; Labor unions--Officials and employees; United States. President's Committee on Equal Employment Opportunity; United States. Committee on Fair Employment Practice; Employment agencies--United States
